name: concordantly
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that agrees with other facts or is based on the same principles as something else: The economic boom has seen an increase in the profits of banks and, concordantly, in the value of their shares. Judges in the Supreme Court tend to vote concordantly with the president who appoints them.
More examplesFewer examplesThe study showed that cold weather affects mood and concordantly influences our behaviour. All the members of the team worked together smoothly and concordantly.As humans became established as the dominant species, the numbers of their competitors declined concordantly.
